paper.title: SOCIOECONOMIC ISSUES IN THE CONTROL OF EAST-COAST FEVER (ECF) WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO KENYA
paper.abstract: The paper analyses the extent to which ticks and tick-borne diseases, particularly East Coast Fever (ECF), are an economic problem in Kenya. It qualitatively argues that several socio-economic factors, viz. inadequate information, indivisility of the main tick control facilities, externalities, and risk make individual farmers undertake less control effects than is optimal for the society. This fact is used to justify a more active role for the state in tick control effects. A simple regression model that tests the impact of ECF on the cattle breed portfolio in the country is presented.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究东海岸热病（ECF）在肯尼亚的经济影响及其控制措施，涉及农业经济学和公共政策，并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域。
